title: Acrillae
description: A Greek colony founded in Sicily ca. 598 B.C., Acrillae was an important economic center. In 213 B.C. the Roman consul M. Claudius Marcellus fought an engagement against the Syracusans there.

properties.description: Location of the modern city of Chiaramonte Gulfi, thought to be in the area of the ancient settlement of Acrillae, based on a representative point derived from an OpenStreetMap node.
properties.title: OSM location of Chiaramonte Gulfi
